definition: out of breath (idiom)/to gasp for air
pinyin: shang4 qi4 bu4 jie1 xia4 qi4

definition: on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)
see 上聲|上声[shang3 sheng1]
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi
(negative prefix)/not/no
to receive/to answer (the phone)/to meet or welcome sb/to connect/to catch/to join/to extend/to take one's turn on duty/to take over for sb
down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi

sentences.english: Breeze Xin I say the time of this sentence, seem to be to have a little out of breath.
sentences.chinese: 風間欣吾說這句話的時候，顯得有點上氣不接下氣。

sentences.english: Out of breath, theys topped at the top of mountain.
sentences.chinese: 他們在山頂停下來時，已是上氣不接下氣。

sentences.english: She was soon out of breath,but she continued to run.
sentences.chinese: 只追了一會兒便上氣不接下氣了，但她還是繼續追趕。

sentences.english: She was soon out of breath, but she continued running.
sentences.chinese: 很快她累得上氣不接下氣，可她繼續跑。

sentences.english: Running as fast as his legs could carry him, Actaeon was soon out of breath .
sentences.chinese: 阿卡同拼命狂奔，很快就上氣不接下氣。

sentences.english: When he dashed back, he was already out of breath.
sentences.chinese: 當他急速跑回來時，他已經是上氣不接下氣了。

sentences.english: Recently, even going upstairs makes me out of breath.
sentences.chinese: 最近，爬樓都會讓我上氣不接下氣的。

sentences.english: We got through the whole duet, and collapsed laughing.
sentences.chinese: 我們唱完了整首對唱，笑得上氣不接下氣。

sentences.english: The water is cold, and by the time I reach the exam room I’m out of breath.
sentences.chinese: 水很涼，我到達檢驗室時上氣不接下氣了。

sentences.english: He was breathless after climbing ten floors.
sentences.chinese: 爬了十層樓，他已上氣不接下氣了。

sentences.english: Take the money and run on, ' my mother said breathlessly.
sentences.chinese: “你拿了錢快跑吧，”我母親上氣不接下氣地說。

sentences.english: But when I climbed the haft way, I was very＇ tired.and quite out of breath.
sentences.chinese: 但當我爬到一半時，我累極了，上氣不接下氣。

sentences.english: The exhausted runner was gasping for air.
sentences.chinese: 那人跑得疲憊已極，上氣不接下氣。

sentences.english: He heard a breathless voice from his doorway.
sentences.chinese: 他聽到門口有上氣不接下氣的喘息聲。

sentences.english: Don't gabble out your story, man, tell it calmly and clearly.
sentences.chinese: 喂，不要上氣不接下氣的說話，冷靜地把情況講清楚。

sentences.english: We were winded by the steep climb.
sentences.chinese: 我們爬那個陡坡累得上氣不接下氣。

definition: to pant/to gasp for breath
hanging one's head dispiritedly (idiom); dejected/crestfallen
confused/rattled/flustered
red in the face/extremely angry
brow beaded with sweat/perspiring freely
lit. lively dragon and animated tiger (idiom)/fig. vigorous and lively
to breathe deeply/to pant
to have a splitting headache (idiom)
to be unable to breathe
lit. crow and peacock make no sound/absolute silence (idiom); not a single voice can be heard/absolute silence
to burst into tears/to sob loudly/to bawl
to move/to shift
at a loss to know what to do (idiom); bewildered
to act with confusion/to be in a flurry/to be flustered
body weary, strength exhausted (idiom); extremely tired/spent
head of a flight of stairs
